editionStmt.edition: Digital edition according to TEI P5

availability.licence: This document is published under the Creative Commons licence Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).

msDesc.head:
Composite manuscript
Trier (Part 1), Würzburg s. X

supportDesc.foliation: Paginated 1-455 with 1, 162 and 163 used twice (here the second time marked with *).
supportDesc.collation: According to Meier pp. 1-271 are regular quaternios with quire marksa-h. On the second part visible on the microfilm are quire marks I to VIII on pp. 285, 301, 317, 333, 349, 365, 381, 397 (all verso), which suggests one quire of 14 leaves (pp. 272-285) and seven quires of 16 leaves (pp. 286-397).

layoutDesc.layout:
Written in 18-19 lines in one column. Smith gives written space:
90 70

In theAratea each verse is written on a separate line starting with versals. Some initials for section were left unexecuted; the sections on constellations are divided by empty line inserted after the corresponding verses or alternatively by marginal note as in the case for Cassiepia and Andromeda, Deltoton.

binding.p: White leather on wood with one clasp, which is now lost (Smith).

history.origin: The manuscript was written in thes. X in Germany or Switzerland.
history.provenance: Since thes. XIV the manuscript is kept in the Stiftsbibliothek in Einsiedeln cf. the note bz a 14th-century hand on p. 457 Gehört gan Einsidlen disses büchl in das gotthuss LXI° (Smith).

listBibl.head: Selected Bibliography:
listBibl.bibl: Hoffmann, Hartmut.Schreibschulen des 10. und des 11. Jahrhunderts im Südwesten des Deutschen Reichs. Vol. 1. 2 vols. Hannover: Hahn, 2004, pp. 124-5.
Bruckner, A.Scriptoria Medii Aevi Helvetica. Vol. 5. 14 vols. Geneva: Roto-Sadag, 1943.

Obbema, Pieter F. J. “Die Handschrift.” InAratea. Faksimile der Handschrift Ms. Voss. Lat. Q.79 der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden, edited by Bernhard Bischoff, 9–29. Luzern: Faksimile-Verl., 1989, here p. 13-14, 34, 60, 65, 91.

Tischer, Matthias M. “Die ottonische Klosterschule in Einsiedeln zur Zeit Abt Gregors. Zum Bildungsprofil des hl. Wolfgang.” InFestschrift zum tausendsten Todestag des Seligen Abtes Gregor, des dritten Abtes von Einsiedeln 996 - 1996, edited by Odo Lang, 93–181. München: Bayerische Benediktinerakademie, 1996, esp. 130-133, 139f.
Aristoteles Latinus Codices. Vol. 2: Supplementa altera. Bruges-Paris: Desclée de Brouwer, 1961, n. 2125, p. 121.
Meier, Gabriel.Catalogus codicum manu scriptorum qui in Bibliotheca Monasterii Einsidlensis O.S.B. servantur. Einsiedeln, 1899, pp. 311-2.
Passalacqua, Marina.I codici di Prisciano. Roma: Edizioni di storia e letteratura, 1978, n. 115, pp. 52-53.

Smith, Lesley et al.Codices Boethiani. A Conspectus of Manuscripts of the Works of Boethius. Vol. 2 Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Luxembourg, The Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland. London: Warburg Institute, 2001, p. 194, n. 47.

msItem.note: Three lines with the Greek alphabet with the corresponding Roman numerals placed above the letters.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: Commentaria in Porphyrium
msItem.incipit: Secundus hic arreptae expositionis labor nostrae seriem translationis expediet
msItem.finalRubric: Ancii Manlii severini boetii v. c. et ill. excons. ord. patritii in ysagoga porphirii id est interpretatione in categorias a se translatas editionis secunde liber V explicit feliciter. Tibi pax amen.
msItem.decoNote: Interlinear and marginal annotations (partly cut off due to rebinding). Diagrams to Book V.

msItem.author: Priscianus
msItem.title: De figuris numerorum
msItem.rubric: De figuris numerorum priscianus gramaticus symacho
msItem.finalRubric: De figuris nvmerorum liber singularis prissciani grammatici caesariensis explicit.
msItem.note: Few marginal notations and underlined phrases.

msItem.author: Priscianus
msItem.title: De metris fabularum Terentii
msItem.rubric: Incipit eiusdem de metris fabularum terentii et aliorum comicorum Prisciani sophistae ars prae exertitaminum secundum hermogenem uel libanium explicit feliciter
msItem.incipit: Cum non colum terentius sed etiam Plautus et ennius ac cuisque et naeuius

msItem.author: Priscianus
msItem.title: Praeexercitamina
msItem.explicit: quod neque potest fieri decent quando dicimus quod inglorium est.

msItem.author: Rufinus
msItem.title: Commentaria in metra Terentiana
msItem.rubric: Commentarium rufini uiri clari gramatici antiochensis in metra terentiana
msItem.incipit: Euanthius in commentario terentii de fibula hoc est de comoedia sic dicit
msItem.explicit: non consulebat. ITEM. Nec rei publicae cosuluisti nec amicis profuisti nec inimicis restitisti.
msItem.finalRubric: Commentarium rufini in metra terentiana finit feliciter.

msItem.decoNote: Underlines of an image of a human figure with drapery (roman style?), holding in the left hand something like a rotulus, while the right hand is bended in front of the chest; note on the upper most pageabauus.

msItem.author: Germanicus
msItem.title: Aratea(Family Z with Fragments III and II
msItem.incipit:
Ab ioue principium magno deduxit aratus
carminis at nobis
msItem.explicit: Festinare putes nunc pigro sidere sumpto
msItem.note: On several places misplaced verses: after v. 64 come vv. 90-95, then vv. 71-89, 96-208; 224-247, 209-223, 256-268, 248-255, 276-285, 387-393, 315-386, 414-725. Few interlinear glosses.
